code:
@pytest.mark.fast
def test_2D_insolation():
    m = climlab.EBM_annual(num_lon=10)
    assert (np.mean(m.subprocess['insolation'].insolation) == pytest.approx(299.3046767096183))
    sfc = m.domains['Ts']
    m.add_subprocess('insolation', climlab.radiation.P2Insolation(domains=sfc, **m.param))
    assert (np.mean(m.subprocess['insolation'].insolation) == pytest.approx(300.344))

code:
@pytest.mark.fast
def test_state():
    initialT0 = (- 273.15)
    sfc = climlab.domain.surface_2D(num_lat=1, num_lon=2)
    sfc = climlab.domain.surface_2D(lat=[(- 90.0), 90.0], lon=[(- 180.0), 180.0])
    state = climlab.surface_state(T0=initialT0, num_lat=1, num_lon=2)
    assert (state.Ts.ndim == 3)
    assert (state.Ts.shape == (1, 2, 1))

code:
@pytest.mark.fast
def test_model_creation(model):
    'Just make sure we can create a model.'
    model_edge = climlab.GreyRadiationModel(num_lev=1, num_lat=1)
    to_xarray(model_edge)
    assert (len(model.lat) == 90)
    to_xarray(model)
